Alex wrote : [quote:2asfgwxo]If you can tell me exactly how to reproduce a crash when editing a condition depending on a condition (send me your ASL file if you need to), I'll take a look into it. [/quote:2asfgwxo]

No, I can't, last time I got a crash by editing a value, next time it didn't crash when I tried again.
I tried also to make intensive and level deep editions when my computer was just started, and QDK didn't crash either.
I think it relies on memories (RAM), and not only on QDK, but it means it's a bit unstable. I'll get a new computer soon and I'll see if it's better.
But yet even some "big" applications don't crash when I use them after using other software.  Since QDK is not very stable, maybe you could, if possible, include a feature for saving in a temp file the working asl file at the times it crashes and display the error message ? OpenOffice is also quite unstable, but it's a good program (btw it's not more unstable than MSWord), and it saves just before crashing, so we can't really lose important data.
